Articles.Content: Well it was a good thing I bought tons of land.So that I can sell it to build some improvements ,and traded some stuff to get more money for improvements.
With the money from steel sales I was able to rebuy the farm and then some. Crisis averted, I'm putting some free food on the Kerbal market to celebrate.
I net 15 tons of food per day, so if you ever start to run low, tell me.
Well I am recovering from the wars ,and now setting my eyes to rebuild my markets that where destroyed in the war.
I'm attacking some Japanese guy for some money, so I can build up my nation faster, there's a few BLOC guys attacking him too...

Oh noe, pony has attacked me.....

He attacked me one time, lost more soldiers than me, I sold one of two oil wells and bought another barracks. He only has 4,000 troops, I'm going to try to match that.

Edited March 6, 2014 by fatfluffycat
I should also mention there are BLOC members on this game ,and created an alliance.So watch out ,and carry one.

I should also mention there are BLOC members on this game ,and created an alliance.So watch out ,and carry one.

Who are the BLOC?

I looked it up and its a band....

BLOC was a politics game about being a little banana republic.

Would you all like to meet up on Skype or Steam or something to that effect? We can see each others' messages quickly.

Having all these troops is really hitting hard on the income...

I bought myself some time by lying to him, I said I'll give 350 oil to stop this war, he said sure thing...

And do you ever think that our enemies look at this forum? There's a link on our Alliance page.
I guess he does, attacked 4 times in a row....
Yeah, we really should have some more clandestine way to keep in contact... Would you like to try some private forum?
Well we got the allaince messaging system.So if you want to tell us something about a war then say it there not here.This can be for requesting aid ,or how are you doing.
Yeah, sorry. I went into editing the alliance when I took over command... didn't realize the trouble it brought...
Herro there. I'm back.

I left the alliance for a while, I sold most of everything I had, I plan to come back in a month.

I'll start from scratch when I get back.
War finally ended and I can rebuild until I get enough points for him to attack me again...
Back my country now has a bank ,and now 2 farms as food production is being out paced by population.

Things are calm, and Futuria and I are forging ahead. Alliance announcements seem to be dead, only higher-ups can use them. Anyone out there want to regroup?

Belated congratulations, MGUARN. ^^
Wow, just saw this thread for the first time. Not entirely sure of what it's like, but I must give this game a look.

Wow, just saw this thread for the first time. Not entirely sure of what it's like, but I must give this game a look.

Yes! Growing and maturing your nation and providing us with additional working stiffs human meatshields proud citizens and valiant defenders of home and country.

Aight, I registered. Looking at where to setup shop. Has everyone in the Alliance chosen a similar geographic location/government system/etc? If not, I'm moving into Northern Greenland (because I'm insane like that) and starting an autocracy (the same reason I have for starting in Greenland).

A different geographic location is best, lets us specialize in producing different things. Greenland, North America area gives you Coal, Iron, and Uranium, which puts you in a good position to manufacture steel, so you can manufacture vehicles and some buildings more easily.

National color gives you a certain bonus to national income based inversely on how many nations are invested in that color. You need to pick the alliance color to get any benefit when in an alliance, green for United Kerbals.

Not sure how government affects stuff, tax rates? What you think? I'm Democracy, Socialist with avg tax rate 33% for comparison

Seems documentation on it is pretty limited (maybe that's intentional) or it's strictly a roleplay element. In the Q&A section it states that economy doesn't actually do anything. It used to, but everyone hated it, so now it just remains as a 'title.'

On Government: "Alliances are eligible to compete for bonuses, and some of the bonuses apply to nations that are in the alliance and have the same government type as the alliance has chosen."

But... for the purposes of this game, having a Democracy would be overkill. Partially in keeping with my namesake on these forums, and trying to do something that feels like the Kerbalverse... inspired by recent events in the World War K series on Youtube,

C0mputer L0rd, Mechjeb, ruler of Arctania, stands ready to serve.
